paper_abstract: A set of necessary and sufficient conditions are derived for the equivalence of an arbitrary pure state and a graph state on n qubits under stochastic local operations and classical communication (SLOCC), using the stabilizer formalism. Because all stabilizer states are equivalent to graph states by local unitary transformations, these conditions constitute a classical algorithm for the determination of SLOCC-equivalence of pure states and stabilizer states. This algorithm provides a distinct advantage over the direct solution of the SLOCC-equivalence condition vertical bar psi > = S vertical bar g > for an unknown invertible local operator S, as it usually allows for easy detection of states that are not SLOCC-equivalent to graph states.
paper_title: TESTING EQUIVALENCE OF PURE QUANTUM STATES AND GRAPH STATES UNDER SLOCC
